image.altText: Black smoke plumes from an aircraft wreckage on an airport runway.

props.synopsis: Emergency crews have doused a fire that erupted at Parafield Airport after a plane crash landed.

title.children: Pilot escapes injury as plane crash causes fire at Parafield Airport

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines flight comes into land at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: SA and NSW health authorities have issued alerts about a potential measles exposure risk, after a person with the disease recently caught a flight from Adelaide to Sydney.

title.children: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites

image.altText: A low sun casts palm trees in silhouette.

props.synopsis: Blisteringly high temperatures are expected throughout Victoria and in parts of South Australia and New South Wales.

title.children: States brace for 'worst' heatwave since Black Summer

image.altText: A woman with glasses looks at the camera in front of a huge monstera plant in a rattan vase

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

title.children: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice

image.altText: The lights of a police car.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old motorcyclist has died in a crash that forced the closure of city-bound lanes on Adelaide's South Eastern Freeway this morning.

title.children: Motorcyclist killed in crash that forced closure of lanes on Adelaide freeway

image.altText: A young man wearing a cap and standing in front of a header.

props.synopsis: When 22-year-old Tanguy Bodiguel's friends said they were travelling to Australia, he left them in Sydney to work on a farm with sentimental value.

title.children: French farmer works the same Australian land his father did 30 years ago

image.altText: A girl with glasses has her left eye partially covered b a hand holding an eye shield

props.synopsis: A group of researchers is calling on the South Australian government to implement a universal vision screening program for all children attending preschools or day care centres.

title.children: Early eye testing helped Lucy avoid blindness

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: Police launch a death in custody investigation, after a 33-year-old man was killed in a crash in an allegedly stolen car that was road-spiked on South Australia's Eyre Highway.

title.children: Death in custody probe launched after fatal crash on SA highway

image.altText: Australia batter Travis Head completes his shot as the ball runs away from him at the SCG.

props.synopsis: Jake Weatherald fails to capitalise on two dropped chances as Ben Stokes strikes after the first drinks break in the final session. Follow live.

title.children: Stokes removes Weatherald after solid opening partnership

image.altText: Thanasi Kokkinakis smiles and clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Thanasi Kokkinakis said he didn't think he'd be able to return to tennis after a 2025 blighted by injury. Instead he's made a winning return alongside doubles partner and all-round showman Nick Kyrgios.

title.children: Tears for Thanasi, grins for Nick as Special Ks make their return

image.altText: Brie cheese.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide retiree who continually ignored orders to remove an unauthorised backyard cheesemaking facility from his suburban home is ordered to pay more than $120,000 in costs, after being found guilty of contempt of court.

title.children: Man told to pay $120,000 over unauthorised backyard cheese business

image.altText: Prawn trays sit in a store display

props.synopsis: After a year dominated by the algal bloom, SA's seafood retailers are breathing a small sigh of relief after some promising Christmas sales — but others in the industry have only just been given the all-clear to get back into business.

title.children: Christmas seafood sales a 'huge relief' amid algal bloom anxiety

image.altText: A snapped pine tree branch lying across a dented silver park bench and metal railing with leaves on the ground.

props.synopsis: Hot weather has caused stressed trees to drop limbs, damaging property across South Australia and injuring one person so far this summer.

title.children: Emergency services kept busy as hot weather downs trees

image.altText: A brown bird with black and red feathers surrounded by the words "most wanted".

props.synopsis: The sighting of a single red-whiskered bulbul in the wild might not seem like a big deal, but this invasive pest could put crops and the environment at risk.

title.children: How this little bird ended up on South Australia's most wanted list

image.altText: A low sun casts palm trees in silhouette.

props.synopsis: Blisteringly high temperatures are expected throughout Victoria and in parts of South Australia and New South Wales.

title.children: States brace for 'worst' heatwave since Black Summer

image.altText: Tennant Creek Police Station sign with tribute flowers on railing in foreground

props.synopsis: Police say the cause of a woman's death in a Northern Territory police watch house last month remains "undetermined" following a post-mortem examination conducted on Friday.

title.children: Cause of woman's death in custody still 'undetermined' after autopsy

image.altText: A photo of womens footballers with arms crossed in huddle.

props.synopsis: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

title.children: League president reported to AFL over 'gender weirdness' alleged comments

image.altText: Novak Djokovic scratching his head with his racquet while on court.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

title.children: Djokovic quits players body he co-founded over transparency concerns

image.altText: Green island surrounded by sea.

props.synopsis: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

title.children: The island in Japan 'whose name cannot be spoken'

image.altText: The rural driveway of a prison with a sign reading "Langi Kal Kal"

props.synopsis: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

title.children: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker

image.altText: A crowd gathered around a pile of floral tributes laid at a memorial procession

props.synopsis: Swiss police say more than half of the 40 people killed after a fire broke out at a bar in the Crans-Montana resort were teenagers.

title.children: All victims of Swiss ski resort bar fire now identified

image.altText: Australian currency

props.synopsis: Almost $300 million in refunds, dividends and cheques remain unclaimed by households and businesses across New South Wales, with locals urged to take action to secure the money they are owed.

title.children: 'We want to get that money back to you': $300m of unclaimed cash in NSW

image.altText: A map showing a large coloured circle labelled "12-U" along the far north Queensland coast.

props.synopsis: The chance of a tropical low off the far north Queensland coast developing into a cyclone is increasing from low to moderate by the weekend, according to the weather bureau.

title.children: Bureau forecasts moderate chance of cyclone hitting far north Queensland coast

image.altText: Sarah Snook looking down at her Critics Choice awards, she's wearing a black suit with white shirt, hair tied back

props.synopsis: Australia's Sarah Snook takes out Best Actress in a Limited Series or Movie Made for Television with All Her Fault, while Jacob Elordi wins Best Supporting Actor for his performance in Frankenstein.

title.children: Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook win at Critics Choice Awards

image.altText: A composite image of an Australian $1 coin and an ASX board

props.synopsis: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

title.children: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?

image.altText: Three men stand in front of a lemon tree looking angry.

props.synopsis: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.

title.children: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango

image.altText: Sam Groth with hand raised with political advertising behind him

props.synopsis: Sam Groth, the deputy leader of the Victorian Liberal Party, has announced he will not contest the upcoming state election in November, saying he made his decision after realising that some recent negative public pressure had come from within his own party.

title.children: Deputy Victorian Opposition Leader Sam Groth won't contest next election

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

title.children: Lower crime rates in Alice Springs leave many optimistic, others worried

image.altText: Fire engulfs Wynnum home

props.synopsis: Family escapes house fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to their dog who raised the alarm.

title.children: Family escapes fire 'by the skin of their teeth' thanks to pet dog

image.altText: A young white boy with short brown hair with his mother, who has longer brown hair, playing with lego at a coffee table

props.synopsis: Developmental delay will be a big part of the new NDIS alternative for some kids. But what does the phrase mean and how can you tell if your child has one?

title.children: The signs your child might have a developmental delay

image.altText: image of police and fire and rescue in front of a building with a police tent and tape

props.synopsis: A passing, off-duty firefighter raised the alarm and tried to kick in the door of a unit in Wollongong in a brave rescue bid earlier today.

title.children: Off-duty fireman tries to rescue man from fatal unit blaze

image.altText: A man in a red shirt, walking away from the courthouse.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old dual national charged over a fatal hit-and-run in Darwin has been granted bail, less than 10 days after the crash which claimed the life of a 27-year-old woman.

title.children: NT court grants bail for alleged hit-run driver, allows overseas travel

image.altText: A woman stands in the front door of a home, looking away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Community housing is seen as a way for the government to tackle the housing crisis, but between limited options and court orders, some people are falling through the cracks.

title.children: Woman who paid back debt faces community housing eviction amid 'other factors'

image.altText: Michele Bullock

props.synopsis: What are you watching in 2026 when it comes to the economy or markets? That's the question we put to the ABC's experts.

title.children: Inflation, tariffs, EVs: What the ABC's business experts are watching in 2026
